title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: How to use qualR
text: State São Paulo Rio de Janeiro one extensive air quality stations network South America. CETESB QUALAR System provide user air quality data State São Paulo. QUALAR System limits download one parameter one air station one year simple query (three parameter advance query). data can missing hours (e.g. due calibration), decimal separator “,”, output CSV file. data.rio hosts air quality information Monitor Ar Program. user-friendly API data needs preprocessor data QUALAR System. qualR surpasses limitations brings R session ready-use data frames information air quality station State São Paulo city Rio de Janeiro.

title: How to use qualR
text: qualR following functions: cetesb_retrieve_param: Download list different parameter one air quality station (AQS) CETESB QUALAR System. cetesb_retrieve_pol: Download criteria pollutants one AQS CETESB QUALAR System. cetesb_retrieve_met: Download meteorological parameters one AQS CETESB QUALAR System. cetesb_retrieve_met_pol: Download meteorological parameters criteria pollutants one AQS CETESB QUALAR System. monitor_ar_retrieve_param: Download list different parameters MonitorAr - Rio program. monitor_ar_retrieve_pol: Download criteria pollutants one AQS MonitorAr - Rio program. monitor_ar_retrieve_met: Download meteorological parameters one AQS MonitorAr - Rio program. monitor_ar_retrieve_met_pol: Download meteorological parameters criteria pollutants one AQS MonitorAr - Rio Program.

what: Example to download data from Rio de Janeiro
title: How to use qualR
text: example want download one year PM10 concentration air quality station located Rio de Janeiro downtown. need following: Check code abbreviation station. Check code abbreviation parameters. air quality station code CA (Estação Centro), PM10 code PM10. use function monitor_ar_retrieve_param(). can download multiple parameters . example, maybe need know relationship PM10 Wind Speed. just need define vector parameters need. Now can make simple plot
code: library(qualR) monitor_ar_aqs #>                         name code       lon       lat x_utm_sirgas2000 #> 1 ESTACAO PEDRA DE GUARATIBA   PG -43.62901 -23.00438         640506.0 #> 2              ESTACAO BANGU   BG -43.47107 -22.88791         656828.8 #> 3       ESTACAO CAMPO GRANDE   CG -43.55652 -22.88625         648064.5 #> 4              ESTACAO IRAJA   IR -43.32684 -22.83162         671696.6 #> 5         ESTACAO COPACABANA   AV -43.18048 -22.96500         686537.0 #> 6             ESTACAO TIJUCA   SP -43.23266 -22.92492         681240.2 #> 7      ESTACAO SAO CRISTOVAO   SC -43.22175 -22.89777         682395.8 #> 8             ESTACAO CENTRO   CA -43.17815 -22.90834         686853.7 #>   y_utm_sirgas2000 #> 1          7455338 #> 2          7468075 #> 3          7468346 #> 4          7474147 #> 5          7459198 #> 6          7463703 #> 7          7466695 #> 8          7465470 monitor_ar_param #>         code                                name units #> 1        SO2                  Dioxido de enxofre ug/m3 #> 2        NO2               Dioxido de nitrogenio ug/m3 #> 3         NO              Monoxido de Nitrogenio ug/m3 #> 4        NOx                Oxidos de nitrogenio ug/m3 #> 5       HCNM Hidrocarbonetos Totais menos Metano   ppm #> 6        HCT              Hidrocarbonetos Totais   ppm #> 7        CH4                              Metano ug/m3 #> 8         CO                 Monoxido de Carbono   ppm #> 9         O3                              Ozonio ug/m3 #> 10      PM10                Particulas Inalaveis ug/m3 #> 11     PM2_5          Particulas Inalaveis Finas ug/m3 #> 12     Chuva          Precipitacao Pluviometrica    mm #> 13      Pres                 Pressao Atmosferica  mbar #> 14        RS                      Radiacao Solar  W/m2 #> 15      Temp                         Temperatura    ºC #> 16        UR              Umidade Relativa do Ar     % #> 17 Dir_Vento                    Direcao do Vento     º #> 18 Vel_Vento                 Velocidade do Vento   m/s rj_centro <- monitor_ar_retrieve_param(start_date = "01/01/2019",                                        end_date = "31/12/2019",                                        aqs_code = "CA",                                        parameters = "PM10") #> Your query is: #> Parameter: PM10 #> Air quality station: ESTACAO CENTRO #> Period: From 01/01/2019 to 31/12/2019 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  PM10 #> Padding out missing dates with NA  head(rj_centro) #>                  date pm10 aqs #> 1 2018-12-31 22:30:00   28  CA #> 2 2018-12-31 23:30:00   27  CA #> 3 2019-01-01 00:30:00   29  CA #> 4 2019-01-01 01:30:00   51  CA #> 5 2019-01-01 02:30:00   73  CA #> 6 2019-01-01 03:30:00  119  CA to_dwld <- c("PM10", "Vel_Vento")  rj_ca_params <- monitor_ar_retrieve_param(start_date = "01/01/2019",                                     end_date = "31/12/2019",                                     aqs_code = "CA",                                     parameters = to_dwld) #> Your query is: #> Parameter: PM10, Vel_Vento #> Air quality station: ESTACAO CENTRO #> Period: From 01/01/2019 to 31/12/2019 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  PM10 Vel_Vento #> Padding out missing dates with NA head(rj_ca_params) #>                  date pm10   ws aqs #> 1 2018-12-31 22:30:00   28 0.62  CA #> 2 2018-12-31 23:30:00   27 0.68  CA #> 3 2019-01-01 00:30:00   29 0.63  CA #> 4 2019-01-01 01:30:00   51 0.85  CA #> 5 2019-01-01 02:30:00   73 0.45  CA #> 6 2019-01-01 03:30:00  119 0.53  CA plot(rj_ca_params$ws, rj_ca_params$pm10,      xlab = "Wind speed (m/s)",      ylab = "",      xlim = c(0,4),      ylim = c(0,120)) mtext(expression(PM[10]~" ("*mu*"g/m"^3*")"), side = 2, line = 2.5)

title: How to use qualR
text: tidyverse powerful collection R package. example using purrrto download data multiple stations ggplot2to visualize relation Ozone air temperature. know Ozone formed photochemical reaction means participation solar radiation. Now can visualize data simultaneity using ggplot2 facet:  PS: Special thanks @beatrizmilz inspiring example.
code: library(qualR) library(purrr)  # Retrieve data from all stations in Rio rj_params <- purrr::map_dfr(.x = qualR::monitor_ar_aqs$code,                              .f = monitor_ar_retrieve_param,                             start_date = "01/01/2020",                             end_date = "31/12/2020",                             parameters = c("O3", "Temp") ) #> Your query is: #> Parameter: O3, Temp #> Air quality station: ESTACAO PEDRA DE GUARATIBA #> Period: From 01/01/2020 to 31/12/2020 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  O3 Temp #> Padding out missing dates with NA #> Your query is: #> Parameter: O3, Temp #> Air quality station: ESTACAO BANGU #> Period: From 01/01/2020 to 31/12/2020 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  O3 Temp #> Padding out missing dates with NA #> Your query is: #> Parameter: O3, Temp #> Air quality station: ESTACAO CAMPO GRANDE #> Period: From 01/01/2020 to 31/12/2020 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  O3 Temp #> Padding out missing dates with NA #> Your query is: #> Parameter: O3, Temp #> Air quality station: ESTACAO IRAJA #> Period: From 01/01/2020 to 31/12/2020 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  O3 Temp #> Padding out missing dates with NA #> Your query is: #> Parameter: O3, Temp #> Air quality station: ESTACAO COPACABANA #> Period: From 01/01/2020 to 31/12/2020 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  O3 Temp #> Padding out missing dates with NA #> Your query is: #> Parameter: O3, Temp #> Air quality station: ESTACAO TIJUCA #> Period: From 01/01/2020 to 31/12/2020 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  O3 Temp #> Padding out missing dates with NA #> Your query is: #> Parameter: O3, Temp #> Air quality station: ESTACAO SAO CRISTOVAO #> Period: From 01/01/2020 to 31/12/2020 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  O3 Temp #> Padding out missing dates with NA #> Your query is: #> Parameter: O3, Temp #> Air quality station: ESTACAO CENTRO #> Period: From 01/01/2020 to 31/12/2020 #> Succesful request #> Downloading  O3 Temp #> Padding out missing dates with NA library(magrittr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'magrittr' #> The following object is masked from 'package:purrr': #>  #>     set_names library(ggplot2)  # making the graph with facet rj_params %>%    ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = tc, y = o3), size = 0.5,  alpha = 0.5) +   labs(x = "Air temperature (º)",        y = expression(O[3]~" ("*mu*"g/m"^3*")"),        caption = "Source: Data from MonitorAr - Rio, retrieved with qualR R package. "        )+   theme_bw()+   facet_wrap(~aqs) #> Warning: Removed 12464 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).

title: How to use qualR
text: qualR functions returns completed data frame (.e. missing hours padded NA) date column POSIXct. ensure compatibility openairpackage. code use openair timeVariation() function. Note preprocessing needed.
code: #install.package("openair") library(openair) openair::timeVariation(rj_centro, pollutant = "pm10")

what: Example to download data from São Paulo State stations
title: How to use qualR
text: use cetesb_retrieve first need create account CETESB QUALAR System. cetesb_retrieve functions similar monitor_ar_retrieve_param functions, require username password arguments. Check section qualR README safely configure user name password R session. example, download Ozone concentration air quality station located Universidade de São Paulo (USP-Ipen) August, 2021. 1. Check station code name Check ozone code abbreviation air quality station 95 ozone code 63. retrieve data use cetesb_retrieve_paramfunction like :
code: head(cetesb_aqs, 15) #>                          name code       lat       lon       loc #> 1                   Americana  290 -22.72425 -47.33955  Interior #> 2                   Araçatuba  107 -21.18684 -50.43932  Interior #> 3                  Araraquara  106 -21.78252 -48.18583  Interior #> 4                       Bauru  108 -22.32661 -49.09276  Interior #> 5                     Cambuci   90 -23.56771 -46.61227      <NA> #> 6             Campinas-Centro   89 -22.90252 -47.05721  Interior #> 7           Campinas-Taquaral  276 -22.87462 -47.05897  Interior #> 8            Campinas-V.União  275 -22.94673 -47.11928  Interior #> 9               Capão Redondo  269 -23.66836 -46.78004 São Paulo #> 10                Carapicuíba  263 -23.53140 -46.83578      MASP #> 11                  Catanduva  248 -21.14194 -48.98308  Interior #> 12                     Centro   94 -23.54781 -46.64241      <NA> #> 13            Cerqueira César   91 -23.55354 -46.67270 São Paulo #> 14 Cid.Universitária-USP-Ipen   95 -23.56634 -46.73741 São Paulo #> 15                  Congonhas   73 -23.61632 -46.66347 São Paulo head(cetesb_param, 15) #>                                          name units code #> 1                               BEN (Benzeno) ug/m3   61 #> 2                    CO (Monoxido de Carbono)   ppm   16 #> 3                       DV (Direcao do Vento)     º   23 #> 4               DVG (Direcao do Vento Global)     º   21 #> 5                ERT (Enxofre Reduzido Total)   ppb   19 #> 6  HCNM (Hidrocarbonetos Totais menos Metano)     -   59 #> 7                 MP10 (Particulas Inalaveis) ug/m3   12 #> 8          MP2.5 (Particulas Inalaveis Finas) ug/m3   57 #> 9                 NO (Monoxido de Nitrogenio) ug/m3   17 #> 10                NO2 (Dioxido de Nitrogenio) ug/m3   15 #> 11                 NOx (Oxidos de Nitrogenio)   ppb   18 #> 12                                O3 (Ozonio) ug/m3   63 #> 13                PRESS (Pressao Atmosferica)   hPa   29 #> 14               RADG (Radiacao Solar Global)  W/m2   26 #> 15             RADUV (Radiacao Ultra-violeta)  W/m2   56 usp_o3 <- cetesb_retrieve_param(username = my_user,                                 password = my_password,                                 parameters = "O3", # or 63                                 aqs_code = "Cid.Universitaria-USP-Ipen",  # or 95                                 start_date = "01/08/2021",                                 end_date = "31/08/2021")

what: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: goal qualR facilitate download air pollutants meteorological information CETESB QUALAR System São Paulo, MonitorAr Program, Rio de Janeiro. information often used air pollution data analysis air quality model evaluation. qualR functions return completed data frames (missing hours padded NA), date column POSIXct temporal aggregation compatibility openair package. qualR improves air pollution research easily producing ready--use datasets, facilitating exploratory data analysis, fostering reproducibility.

title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: First, need install devtools: , can install qualR : , can install directly using:
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ropensci/qualR") install.packages('qualR', repos = c('https://ropensci.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))

title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: qualR following functions: cetesb_retrieve_param: Download list different parameter one air quality station (AQS) CETESB QUALAR System. cetesb_retrieve_pol: Download criteria pollutants one AQS CETESB QUALAR System. cetesb_retrieve_met: Download meteorological parameters one AQS CETESB QUALAR System. cetesb_retrieve_met_pol: Download meteorological parameters criteria pollutants one AQS CETESB QUALAR System. monitor_ar_retrieve_param: Download list different parameters MonitorAr - Rio program. monitor_ar_retrieve_pol: Download criteria pollutants one AQS MonitorAr - Rio program. monitor_ar_retrieve_met: Download meteorological parameters one AQS MonitorAr - Rio program. monitor_ar_retrieve_met_pol: Download meteorological parameters criteria pollutants one AQS MonitorAr - Rio Program. functions return data frame, date column POSIXct, allows use packages data analysis, openair. download information São Paulo, first need account CETESB QUALAR system. , can sign CETESB QUALAR system. MonitorAr doesn’t require account. know AQS parameter codes (.e. pollutant meteorological data) use functions. Currently, cetesb_retrieve family functions also accept parameter abbreviation (.e “O3” instead 63), complete name AQS (.e “Pinheiros” instead 99) inputs. check parameters can check following datasets:
code: library(qualR)  # To see all CETESB AQS names with their codes and lat lon cetesb_aqs  # To see all CETESB AQS parameters with their codes and abbreviation cetesb_param  # To see all MonitorAr-Rio AQS names with their codes and lat and lon monitor_ar_aqs  # To see all MonitorAr-Rio parameters with their codes monitor_ar_param

previous_headings: Using qualR to download CETESB data
what: Downloading multiple parameter from one AQS
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: want download Ozone information Pinheiros AQS, January first January 7th, can : (Note: Previous cetesb_retrieve function now depreciated use cetesb_retrieve_param instead) Maybe just need couple parameters. example, want download ozone wind speed direction Pinheiros AQS, can following:
code: library(qualR)  cetesb_aqs # To check Pinheiros aqs_code cetesb_param # To check Ozone pol_code  my_user_name <- "john.doe@mymail.com" my_password <- "drowssap" pin_code <- 99 start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  pin_o3 <- cetesb_retrieve_param(my_user_name,                               my_password,                               "O3",                               pin_code, # It could also be "Pinheiros"                               start_date,                               end_date) library(qualR)  cetesb_aqs # To check Pinheiros aqs_code  my_user_name <- "john.doe@mymail.com" my_password <- "drowssap" start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  cetesb_param # To check ozone, wind speed and wind direction abbreviations  pin_o3_ws_wd <- cetesb_retrieve_param(my_user_name,                                     my_password,                                     c("O3", "VV", "VD"),                                     "Pinheiros",                                     start_date = "01/01/2020",                                     end_date = "07/01/2020")

previous_headings: Using qualR to download CETESB data
what: Downloading criteria pollutants from one AQS
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: use cetesb_retrieve_pol. function already parameter codes O3, , NO2, NOX, CO, PM10 PM2.5. , doesn’t require pol_code, aqs_code. CO ppm NOX ppb, pollutants μg/m3. example, download pollutants Pinheiros AQS.
code: library(qualR)  cetesb_aqs # To check Pinheiros aqs_code  my_user_name <- "john.doe@mymail.com" my_password <- "drowssap" pin_code <- 99 start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  pin_pol <- cetesb_retrieve_pol(my_user_name,                              my_password,                              pin_code, # It could also be "Pinheiros"                              start_date,                              end_date)

previous_headings: Using qualR to download CETESB data
what: Downloading meteorological parameters from one AQS
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: use cetesb_retrieve_met. function already parameter codes Temperature (°C), Relative Humidity (%), Wind Speed (m/s) wind Direction (°), Pressure (hPa). , doesn’t require pol_code, aqs_code. example, download parameters Pinheiros AQS. Remember CETESB uses 777 888 values wind direction indicate calm wind data, values appear final data frame.
code: library(qualR)  cetesb_aqs # To check Pinheiros aqs_code  my_user_name <- "john.doe@mymail.com" my_password <- "drowssap" pin_code <- 99 start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  pin_met <- cetesb_retrieve_met(my_user_name,                              my_password,                              pin_code, # It could also be Pinheiros                              start_date,                              end_date)

previous_headings: Using qualR to download CETESB data
what: Downloading meteorological and criteria pollutant from one AQS
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: equivalent run cetesb_retrieve_met cetesb_retrieve_pol time, return data one data frame.
code: library(qualR)  cetesb_aqs # To check Pinheiros aqs_code  my_user_name <- "john.doe@mymail.com" my_password <- "drowssap" pin_code <- 99 start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  pin_all <- cetesb_retrieve_met_pol(my_user_name,                                 my_password,                                 pin_code,                                 start_date,                                 end_date)

previous_headings: Using qualR to download CETESB data > Some other examples
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: Now, want download information Ibirapuera AQS, export data .csv read software. qualR functions argument to_csv, default FALSE value. , want export data csv, just need change TRUE. csv file following file name: {aqs_name}_{pol}_{start_date}_{end_date}.csv. functions retrieve one parameter file name : {aqs_name}_{TYPE}_{start_date}_{end_date}.csv, TYPE “POL”, “MET”, “MET_POL”. case, get file Ibirapuera_MET_POL_01-01-2020_07-01-2020.csv.
code: library(qualR)  cetesb_aqs # To check Ibirapuera aqs_code  my_user_name <- "john.doe@mymail.com" my_password <- "drowssap" ibi_code <- 83 start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  ibi_all <- cetesb_retrieve_met_pol(my_user_name,                                 my_password,                                 ibi_code,                                 start_date,                                 end_date,                                 to_csv = TRUE)

previous_headings: Using qualR to download CETESB data > Some other examples
what: A variable from all CETESB AQS
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: Sometimes, check spatial distribution air pollutants, need download pollutant AQS. example, download year Ozone CETESB AQS.
code: library(qualR)  my_user_name <- "john.doe@mymail.com" my_password <- "drowssap" o3_code <- 63 start_date <- "01/01/2019" end_date <- "31/12/2019"  # All_o3 is a list with a data frame per AQS all_o3 <- lapply(cetesb_aqs$code, cetesb_retrieve_param,                  username = my_user_name,                  password = my_password,                  parameters = "O3",                  start_date = start_date,                  end_date = end_date)  # If you want  to export all in csv all_o3_csv <- do.call(rbind, all_o3) write.table(all_o3_csv, "all_o3_csv.csv", sep = ",", row.names = F)

previous_headings: Using qualR to download CETESB data > Some other examples
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: Maybe need make map AQS used study. Now, added latitude longitude degrees cetesb_aqs dataset: examples make plots: * pollutant concentration point map. * AQS location map. * AQS location map using shapefiles.
code: library(qualR)  # To see all the AQS latitude and longitude cetesb_aqs

previous_headings: Using qualR to download CETESB data > Some other examples
what: A better way to save your credentials
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: safe write user password coding, even dangerous share scripts. reason, better practice (safer) save credentials (.e. user password) global environment. easier way using usethis package. , first install : use function edit_r_environ(). show new file called .Renviron, ’ll define user password. open .Renviron file, define credentials: Save , changes work restart R. call , use Sys.getenv(). now, replicate previous example Downloading multiple parameter one AQS, something like : idea came awesome post.
code: install.packages("usethis") library(usethis)  edit_r_environ() QUALAR_USER="john.doe@mymail.com" QUALAR_PASS="drowssap" library(qualR)  cetesb_aqs # To check Pinheiros aqs_code cetesb_param # To check Ozone pol_code  o3_code <- 63 pin_code <- 99 start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  pin_o3 <- cetesb_retrieve_param(Sys.getenv("QUALAR_USER"), # calling your user                               Sys.getenv("QUALAR_PASS"),  # calling your passord                                 o3_code,                               pin_code,                               start_date,                               end_date)

previous_headings: Using qualR to download MonitorAr - Rio data
what: Downloading one parameter from one AQS
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: download Ozone information Iraja AQS February 2019 using monitor_ar_retrieve_param function.
code: library(qualR) monitor_ar_aqs # To check Iraja AQS code monitor_ar_param # To check Ozone code  start_date <- "01/02/2019" end_date <- "01/03/2019" aqs_code <- "IR" param <- "O3"  ir_o3 <- monitor_ar_retrieve_param(date_start, date_end, aqs_code, param)

previous_headings: Using qualR to download MonitorAr - Rio data
what: Downloading multiple parameters from one AQS
title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: monitor_ar_retrieve_param similar cetesb_retrieve_param, allows us download multiple parameters. , download Ozone, Nitric oxide, Nitrogen dioxide, wind speed direction.
code: library(qualR) monitor_ar_aqs # To check Iraja AQS code monitor_ar_param # To check parameter codes  date_start <- "01/02/2019" date_end <- "01/03/2019" aqs_code <- "IR" params <- c("O3", "NO", "NO2", "Dir_Vento", "Vel_Vento")   ir_data <- monitor_ar_retrieve_param(date_start, date_end, aqs_code, params)

title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: CETESB QUALAR system describes midnight 24:00, first hour day starts 1:00. qualR transform get time 00-23 hour notation, reason ’ll get NA 00:00 first downloaded day. , consider download one day study period. pad-NA missing date, qualR “tricks” date information, assume ’s UTC (reality ’s “America/Sao_Paulo” time). avoids problems merging data frames also Daylight saving time (DST) issues. Beware ,dealing study periods include DST. always good idea, double check retrieving suspicious date CETESB QUALAR system. Take account CETESB data, hourly averaged mean hour. , concentration value 22:00 mean 21:01 22:00. Consider previous three points need change local time UTC. Currently, MonitorAr data March, 2021.

title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: Please note package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: Thanks CETESB MonitorAr Program make public atmospheric data. work supported Wellcome Trust [grant number 216087/Z/19/Z]. acknowledge programs CAPES (Coordenadoria de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior), CNPq (Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico), FAPESP (2016/18438-0 - Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa Estado São Paulo). Finally, want thanks LAPAT-IAG team test help improve qualR.

title: An R package to download São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro air pollution data
text: hope package help research!

title: CETESB Parameters — cetesb_param
text: List CETESB QUALAR available parameters units. Use check parameters argument. Parameter names without diacritics.

title: CETESB Parameters — cetesb_param
code: cetesb_param

title: CETESB Parameters — cetesb_param
text: data frame 20 observations 3 variables: name CETESB QUALAR parameter abbreviation name. units Parameter units. code Parameter CETESB QUALAR code.

title: CETESB Parameters — cetesb_param
code: cetesb_param #>                                          name units code #> 1                               BEN (Benzeno) ug/m3   61 #> 2                    CO (Monoxido de Carbono)   ppm   16 #> 3                       DV (Direcao do Vento)     º   23 #> 4               DVG (Direcao do Vento Global)     º   21 #> 5                ERT (Enxofre Reduzido Total)   ppb   19 #> 6  HCNM (Hidrocarbonetos Totais menos Metano)     -   59 #> 7                 MP10 (Particulas Inalaveis) ug/m3   12 #> 8          MP2.5 (Particulas Inalaveis Finas) ug/m3   57 #> 9                 NO (Monoxido de Nitrogenio) ug/m3   17 #> 10                NO2 (Dioxido de Nitrogenio) ug/m3   15 #> 11                 NOx (Oxidos de Nitrogenio)   ppb   18 #> 12                                O3 (Ozonio) ug/m3   63 #> 13                PRESS (Pressao Atmosferica)   hPa   29 #> 14               RADG (Radiacao Solar Global)  W/m2   26 #> 15             RADUV (Radiacao Ultra-violeta)  W/m2   56 #> 16                   SO2 (Dioxido de Enxofre) ug/m3   13 #> 17                   TEMP (Temperatura do Ar)    ºC   25 #> 18                              TOL (Tolueno) ug/m3   62 #> 19                UR (Umidade Relativa do Ar)     %   28 #> 20                   VV (Velocidade do Vento)   m/s   24

what: Download a single parameter from CETESB QUALAR system — cetesb_retrieve
title: Download a single parameter from CETESB QUALAR system — cetesb_retrieve
text: function download one parameter one air quality stations (AQS) CETESB AQS network. pad date missing data NA.

title: Download a single parameter from CETESB QUALAR system — cetesb_retrieve
code: cetesb_retrieve(   username,   password,   pol_code,   aqs_code,   start_date,   end_date,   verbose = TRUE,   to_csv = FALSE )

title: Download a single parameter from CETESB QUALAR system — cetesb_retrieve
text: username User name CETESB QUALAR password User name's password CETESB QUALAR pol_code Code parameter aqs_code Code AQS start_date Date start downloading dd/mm/yyyy end_date Date end downloading dd/mm/yyyy verbose Print query summary to_csv Creates csv file. FALSE default

title: Download a single parameter from CETESB QUALAR system — cetesb_retrieve
text: data.frame selected parameter information

title: Download a single parameter from CETESB QUALAR system — cetesb_retrieve
code: if (FALSE) { # Downloading Ozone information from Pinheiros AQS # from January first to 7th of 2020 my_user_name <- "John Doe" my_pass_word <- "drowssap" o3_code <- 63  # Check with cetesb_param pin_code <- 99 # Check with cetesb_aqs start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  pin_o3 <- cetesb_retrieve(my_user_name, my_pass_word, o3_code, pin_code,                           start_date, end_date)  }

what: Download meteorological parameters from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met
title: Download meteorological parameters from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met
text: function download main meteorological parameters model evaluation one air quality station (AQS) CETESB AQS network. pad date missing data NA. function requires account CETESB QUALAR.

title: Download meteorological parameters from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met
code: cetesb_retrieve_met(   username,   password,   aqs_code,   start_date,   end_date,   verbose = TRUE,   to_csv = FALSE,   csv_path = "" )

title: Download meteorological parameters from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met
text: username User name CETESB QUALAR password User name's password CETESB QUALAR aqs_code Code AQS start_date Date start downloading dd/mm/yyyy end_date Date end downloading dd/mm/yyyy verbose Print query summary to_csv Creates csv file. FALSE default csv_path Path save csv file.

title: Download meteorological parameters from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met
text: data.frame Temperature (C), Relative Humidity (%), Wind Speed (m/s) Direction (degrees), Pressure information.

title: Download meteorological parameters from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met
code: if (FALSE) { # Downloading meteorological data from Pinheiros AQS # from January first to 7th of 2020 my_user_name <- "John Doe" my_pass_word <- "drowssap" pin_code <- 99 # Check with cetesb_aqs start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  pin_pol <- cetesb_retrieve_met(my_user_name, my_pass_word, pin_code,                                start_date, end_date) }

what: Download meteorological and pollutant data from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met_pol
title: Download meteorological and pollutant data from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met_pol
text: function download main meteorological parameters model evaluation, together criteria pollutants one air quality station (AQS). pad date missing data NA. function required account CETESB QUALAR.

title: Download meteorological and pollutant data from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met_pol
code: cetesb_retrieve_met_pol(   username,   password,   aqs_code,   start_date,   end_date,   verbose = TRUE,   to_csv = FALSE,   csv_path = "" )

title: Download meteorological and pollutant data from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met_pol
text: username User name CETESB QUALAR password User name's password CETESB QUALAR aqs_code Code AQS start_date Date start downloading dd/mm/yyyy end_date Date end downloading dd/mm/yyyy verbose Print query summary to_csv Creates csv file. FALSE default csv_path Path save csv file.

title: Download meteorological and pollutant data from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met_pol
text: data.frame Temperature (C), Relative Humidity (%), Wind Speed (m/s) Direction (degrees), Pressure information (hPa), O3, , NO2, NOx, PM2.5, PM10 CO information.

title: Download meteorological and pollutant data from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_met_pol
code: if (FALSE) { # Downloading main meteorological parameters and criteria pollutants # from Pinheiros AQS from January first to 7th of 2020 my_user_name <- "John Doe" my_pass_word <- "drowssap" pin_code <- 99 # Check with cetesb_aqs start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  pin_all <- cetesb_retrieve_met_pol(my_user_name, my_pass_word, pin_code,                                    start_date, end_date)  }

what: Download list of observation from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_param
title: Download list of observation from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_param
text: function downloads parameters vector. parameters can pollutants meteorological observations one air quality station (AQS). pad date missing data NA. function requires account CETESB QUALAR.

title: Download list of observation from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_param
code: cetesb_retrieve_param(   username,   password,   parameters,   aqs_code,   start_date,   end_date,   verbose = TRUE,   to_csv = FALSE,   csv_path = "" )

title: Download list of observation from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_param
text: username User name CETESB QUALAR password User name's password CETESB QUALAR parameters character vector parameters abbreviations download aqs_code Code AQS start_date Date start downloading dd/mm/yyyy end_date Date end downloading dd/mm/yyyy verbose Print query summary to_csv Creates csv file. FALSE default csv_path Path save csv file

title: Download list of observation from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_param
text: data.frame parameters described params vector

title: Download list of observation from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_param
code: if (FALSE) { # Download ozone, nitrogen dioxide, and wind speed # from Pinheiros AQS, from January first to 7th of 2020  my_user_name <- "John Doe" my_pass_word <- "drowssap" pin_code <- 99 # Check with cetesb_aqs start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020" params <- c("o3","NOX", "VV")  pin_param <- cetesb_retrieve_param(my_user_name, my_pass_word,                                    params, pin_code,                                    start_date, end_date) }

title: Download criteria pollutants from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_pol
text: username User name CETESB QUALAR password User name's password CETESB QUALAR aqs_code Code AQS start_date Date start downloading dd/mm/yyyy end_date Date end downloading dd/mm/yyyy verbose Print query summary to_csv Creates csv file. FALSE default csv_path Path save csv file

title: Download criteria pollutants from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_pol
text: data.frame O3, , NO2, PM2.5, PM10 CO information. Units ug/m3 except CO ppm, NOx ppb.

title: Download criteria pollutants from CETESB QUALAR — cetesb_retrieve_pol
code: if (FALSE) { # Downloading criteria pollutants from Pinheiros AQS # from January first to 7th of 2020 my_user_name <- "John Doe" my_pass_word <- "drowssap" pin_code <- 99 # Check with cetesb_aqs start_date <- "01/01/2020" end_date <- "07/01/2020"  pin_pol <- cetesb_retrieve_pol(my_user_name, my_pass_word, pin_code,                                start_date, end_date)  }

code: monitor_ar_aqs

text: data frame 8 observation 6 variables: name MonitorAr Program AQS name. code MonitorAr Program AQS abbreviation. lon MonitorAr Program AQS longitude. lat MonitorAr Program AQS latitude. x_utm_sirgas2000 MonitorAr Program AQS longitude SIRGAS 2000 (EPSG:31983). y_utm_sirgas2000 MonitorAr Program AQS latitude SIRGAS 2000 (EPSG:31983).

code: monitor_ar_param

text: data frame 18 observations 3 variables: code MonitorAr parameter abbreviation code. name MonitorAr parameter name units Parameter units.

code: monitor_ar_param #>         code                                name units #> 1        SO2                  Dioxido de enxofre ug/m3 #> 2        NO2               Dioxido de nitrogenio ug/m3 #> 3         NO              Monoxido de Nitrogenio ug/m3 #> 4        NOx                Oxidos de nitrogenio ug/m3 #> 5       HCNM Hidrocarbonetos Totais menos Metano   ppm #> 6        HCT              Hidrocarbonetos Totais   ppm #> 7        CH4                              Metano ug/m3 #> 8         CO                 Monoxido de Carbono   ppm #> 9         O3                              Ozonio ug/m3 #> 10      PM10                Particulas Inalaveis ug/m3 #> 11     PM2_5          Particulas Inalaveis Finas ug/m3 #> 12     Chuva          Precipitacao Pluviometrica    mm #> 13      Pres                 Pressao Atmosferica  mbar #> 14        RS                      Radiacao Solar  W/m2 #> 15      Temp                         Temperatura    ºC #> 16        UR              Umidade Relativa do Ar     % #> 17 Dir_Vento                    Direcao do Vento     º #> 18 Vel_Vento                 Velocidade do Vento   m/s

what:
qualR: An R package to download Sao Paulo and Rio de Janeiro
air pollution data — qualR
title:
qualR: An R package to download Sao Paulo and Rio de Janeiro
air pollution data — qualR
text: package download information CETESB QUALAR https://cetesb.sp.gov.br/ar/qualar/ MonitorAr http://jeap.rio.rj.gov.br/je-metinfosmac/institucional/index.html systems. contains function download different parameters, set criteria pollutants frequent meteorological parameters used air quality data analysis air quality model evaluation.

title:
qualR: An R package to download Sao Paulo and Rio de Janeiro
air pollution data — qualR
text: Mario Gavidia-Calderon Daniel Schuch Maria de Fatima Andrade

title: qualR 0.9.6
text: Function names CamelCase snake_case Better consistent naming returned data frames variables datasets.

title: qualR 0.9.6
text: Updated qualR site. Vignette examples available.

title: qualR 0.9.5
text: CetesbRetrive function now depreciated. Use CetesbRetrieveParam instead. CetesbRetrieveAll now called CetesbRetrieveMetPol

title: qualR 0.9.5
text: Monitor Ar Program air quality network included. Download meteorological parameters air pollution Rio de Janeiro city now available MonitorArRetrieve functions. functions verbose option print query summary. functions can export downloaded data .csv files. Units added parameters datasets cetesb_paramand monitor_ar_param.

title: qualR 0.9.5
text: Now qualR uses httr instead RCurl package fix SSL23_SERVER_HELLO error Windows.

title: qualR 0.9.1
text: Initial version Download one parameter one air quality station CetesbRetrieve function. Download criteria pollutants one air quality station CetesbRetrievePol function. Download meteorological parameters one air quality station CetesbRetrieveMet function. Download criteria pollutants meteorological parameters one air quality station CetesbRetrieveAll function.
